indications: Plerixafor Injection is indicated in combination with filgrastim to mobilize hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) to the peripheral blood for collection and subsequent autologous transplantation in patients with non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma (NHL) or multiple myeloma (MM).
contraindications: Initiate Plerixafor Injection treatment after the patient has received filgrastim once daily for 4 days. ( 2.1 ) Repeat Plerixafor Injection dose up to 4 consecutive days. ( 2.1 ) Dose based on patient weight Less than or equal to 83 kg: 20 mg dose or select dose based on 0.24 mg/kg actual body weight. ( 2.1 ) greater than 83 kg: select dose based on 0.24 mg/kg actual body weight. ( 2.1 ) Administer by subcutaneous injection approximately 11 hours prior to initiation of apheresis. ( 2.1 ) Renal impairment: If creatinine clearance is ≤50 mL/min, decrease dose by one-third to 0.16 mg/kg. ( 2.3 )
warningsAndPrecautions:
Plerixafor Injection 24 mg/1.2 mL (20 mg/mL) is a sterile, preservative-free, clear, colorless to pale-yellow solution supplied in a clear glass single-dose vial.
                  NDC Number: 0480-4320-01
                  Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F); excursions permitted to 15° to 30°C (59° to 86° F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
adverseReactions: Plerixafor Injection is contraindicated in patients with a history of hypersensitivity to plerixafor [see Warnings and Precautions (5.1)]. Anaphylactic shock has occurred with use of Plerixafor Injection.
name: Plerixafor
